titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: The morning was pleasantly occupied in a motor–drive through Annan, Locherbie, Ecclefechan, & Dumfries. The views on all side [sic] are very beautiful.
After lunch Murray & I walked to the Brae Hill and sate down enjoying the lovely prospect & talking of many things.
I sent copies of the Pan–Anglican Congress sermon to Miss Chalmers, & Dr McGregor.
